title: (x) 'plain text' font in TextEdit - Monaco {Florian}
content:
is there a bitmap font (or otherwise) that is the same as what is available in TextEdit when you work in 'plain text'

if anyone knows of something exact or very close let me know. thx.

(samples attached)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140401132347im_/http:/typophile.com/files/statement2_5145.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140401132347im_/http:/typophile.com/files/statement_6437.gif)
author: c-coy

comments.content: Hi, that’s Monaco. You can check/change it in your TextEdit preferences.

great. thanks. :)

for anyone who is interested, there is a version closer to the bitmap (called MPW) that is "essentially a straight conversion of the bitmap font into an outline font with the addition of some of the same disambiguation features as were added to the TrueType Monaco." (wikipedia)

link for download via apple.com is [here](ftp://ftp.apple.com/developer/Tool_Chest/Core_Mac_OS_Tools/MPW_etc./Miscellaneous/MPW_Font.sit.hqx)

it is a little heavier though than the sample earlier in thread.
